name: CastleMiner Z
description: CastleMiner Z is an infinite world filled with deep places to explore, and horrifying monsters to slay. Build structures out of blocks, craft weapons and tools from raw materials, and explore the vast and frightening world around you.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 8, 7 , Vista, XP Processor: 2.8 GHZ Dual Core Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9.0c or better with 500 mb memory DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: Direct X Compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 8, 7 Processor: 3.0 ghz Quad Core or Better Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9.0c or better with 1 GB memory DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: Direct X Compatible

reviews.review_text: Such a shame. Graphics are nice, (except for the amount of dust while mining obscuring the block you're aiming at). Nice, dark feel. A promising crafting system and potential for so much more. Unfortunately, as far a I can tell, nothing of any significance had happened since last May.  It's almost as if the developers have released a half-finished project for sale and just cut and run with the money. Kickstarter projects and early release accesses require a certain element of trust.   To my mind, and I'm sorry for all the honourable, hard-working, independant developers out there, this has put me off funding/supporting projects-in-development for good.
Have no idea why this is being sold on Steam when you can go to thier webiste and download it for free.
This was my most worthless purchase ever. I played for 7min then I regreted that I bought it and wished that I would have bought a foot long sandwitch at subway instead. :(

Edit: I intended to play since the latest updates, but have not had the willpower to really solo it. At the time of my review the developer had moved over to working on the game Savage Lands.  It feels like ages since I purchased this on Xbox. I had built a road with my friends to the end of the world and generally enjoyed the gameplay.  Now it is on PC and it is almost exactly the same as it was on the 360 (with a few upgrades from patches I had missed).  Pros: +Fun in multiplayer +Decent gameplay mechanics +Cheap  Cons: -Graphics are decent for what it is, but not great. Block textures look better than minecraft, but the monsters look like they belong to the era of N64 -Playing alone is boring -Occasional bugs -The game is dead. The developer came back to post something along the lines of 'We won't abandon you', then went silent to this community while they work on The Savage Lands. If you buy this, never expect an update.  Over all, it isn't a terrible game. It was made the way it is for reasons, and it could in theory continue to evolve and get better since the move to PC, but it seems dead now. As the game it is, it works fine (for me at least) with the only drawback for me being that only one of my friends has it.

This game DEFFINATELY needs many updates...it's like early alpha state, enemies spawn randomly and spawnrape you, health system is weird(you get hit 1-3 times and you die, recovery to full health when not hit for like 3-5 seconds), needs MANY new items to craft like windows,fences and so on... And would be nice if they would add some new NPCs like animals and that, because if they tried to create minecraft clone, at least try to make it a GOOD one! Because right now it feels like total ripoff, i even read about the creator cencorship, that they remove all negative comments. Well, this isnt a negative comment, this is just a recommendation what should be tweaked in this game to make it better.

An instant classic in my book ! Miner, Crafter, First-person shooter. Make your own gear and battle ruthless mobs. Run as far as your free time will allow you to in and endless world. Several game modes and Hosting options. Go from digging dirt, to using a scoped rifles to shoot Dragons out of the sky. Multiplayer with optional PvP, even Team PVP, this game is among a unique rarity on Steam!   Voxel with stunning HD Textures and views 7 Biomes in a ringed pattern on an endless globe 7 Tiers of materials that you have to earn Best voxel game mobs because they're not voxel at all  Very smooth mechanics Controller support Aim accuracy Awesome sound FX Very cool soundtrack  Only complaints from me: using Ultra Distance View lags me Dust from mining/explosions lags me Game needs way more music Gets kinda glitchy after 20,000 distance Can't host a Dragon Endurance game using a Creation made map. When I do Host, I have to hire police to monitor players because I cannot 'Lock' the map (turn off mining).  Read my epic Castleminer Z tale   Path of the Compass   where I bravely travel further than  any  other player on record!! Current distance = 250,000

As you can see, a lot of the reviews are complaining about the similarities to Minecraft, i.e; crafting, survival, zombies, etc. However there are many games like Minecraft nowadays. Minecraft is no longer the only 'block building' game in town. With so many different games out there like Blockland, FortressCraft, Guncraft, and CastleMiner Z - it's easy for people to complain that each new iteration in the genre is a 'shameless cash grab'. CastleMiner Z might fall under that classification, but that doesn't mean it isn't a fun game. I have put a couple hours into this game and have had a good time. I would recommend it, especially since it is such a cheap game. It's not like you have much to lose.

This game is hilariously bad. From terrible graphics to aweful mechanics to a bug-infested enviroment, this game is a travesty. This said, being hilariously bad, it is absolutely hilarious. It is a game that you and some friends can sit down and play for 5 hours and then never play again. The game is braindead easy, as you can bypass all conventional methods of mining by entering the Hell zone immediately and killing low health mobs for virtually unlimited resources. Also, if you back into a wall, you pass into it. You can do this to literally get absurd distances with no effort. The zombies jump incredible distances and will almost always end up behind you. To boot, they make you extremely slow when they touch you. Likelyhood is they give you cancer. 3/10, wouldn't play it again.

So I bought CastleMinerZ in the early 2014s thinking 'Hey I have played this game on xbox and it was fun so I should get it on the computer.' I played for 1 hour and after that hour got up and deleted it off my desktop and walked away. One day I was bored and redownloaded this game and decided to give this game 1 hour to prove it's worth of 5 dollars. I sat down watched it download and pressed play. Lets just start off by saying I play CSGO, in CSGO I have my sensitivity at around 1.30-1.40. This game dosen't let you change your sensitivity at all. I'm basicly walking around while my mouse goes zooming around my screen at the slightest of movement. Don't even get me started on the nasty sounds or the hardcore amounts of damage you take along with the insane HP regen. The game is basicly a damn port from the xbox but somehow is WORSE than the xbox version. To conclude instead of giving this game 1 hour of my time I gave it 5 minutes and clicked EXIT. I guess for 5 dollars you can't go wrong but still its a waste.

It's a fun Co-op game. Played for 11 hours today with a friend. ended up having way more stuff then we really needed and when we faced the undead dragon we had 8 anti dragon rocket luncher each. We ended up exploring further incase we missed something, but that was it. I felt like the game could have had more stuff, something more to explore, or something more to do. Like a tradeable village or more bosses or dungeon kind of thing, empty wherehouse for example. The game just felt short and if we hadnt spent hours mining (had around 1000 diamonds) we would have probly played lots less because it felt kinda like lack of content. But the game was really fun nonetheless.

So, to start off,This won't be a pros and cons review, just a recommendation. Please read on to see what I mean.   I only recommend this game because of it's nearly unlimited fun it contains when playing with a group of friends (At least 2-4 other people). This isn't a game I would play alone because there isn't too much to do; once you get to laser weapons and such you're pretty much done. But with friends, you tend to ignore all the cons of this unpolished indie adventure game so to speak and just enjoy exploring and slaying enemies/dragons with your friends, making the experience much more enjoyable.    Not to mention, you can get this game on the castle miner site for FREE. The only reason I see to purchase this via steam is to game with friends. To conclude, don't buy this game unless you have friends that are down for it. Besides all that, great game in my opinion, could use lots more work and updates but sadly the owners abandoned the game. Had great potential  R.I.P Castle-Miner Z 8/8 would get chased by Satan again for another $2

CastleMiner Z Is a great, yet hard game that has screaming sprinting zombies, yelling crazy aliens with knives for their right hand and the ever popular SPOOKY SCARY SKELETON!!! These are brutal and unforgiving yet fun to shoot in the face! the game also has some medeival elements such as dragons, lots of trees and the satisfying blacksmith hammer noise when you craft something. There are also some futuristic features such as lazer guns and swords if you ever wanted to be a jedi or storm trooper. If you don't like getting owned by the undead from the underworld, you can turn the monsters off. The game's visuals are amazing! It runs super quick even on my laptop! It still runs great even with a high visual setting. If building is more your cup of tea, then try the creative mode. I really like this game, and at such a low price the game is impossible to say no to. P.S. the game has a slight chance to slow down in the framerate department, so make sure your computer is well optimized!

When I look at this game, I think the meeting for the concept of the game went down like this: 'HEY BOB, THE KIDS SEEM TO BE INTO THIS...UH...MINECRAFT THING, IT ISN'T ON CONSOLES YET.' 'THEN HOW ABOUT WE MAKEA CHEAP KNOCKOFF OF IT FOR CONSOLES, TIM?' 'OR BETTER YET,BOB, RIGHT BEFORE IT RELEASES ON CONSOLES?!' 'GREAT IDEA TIM! YOU'VE EARNED A PROMOTION'  So...after that, heres my opinion.  Castleminer Z was a originally a console game, before being ported to PC. I have played it on consoles, and it hasn't changed much between ports.  It was apparently released the same time as the Minecraft console ports, which makes it worse.  The game in itself is enjoyable, to an extent.It hasn't got NEARLY as much secrets or variety as the thing it's knocking off.And even though I'm not really bothered by graphics, for a 2011 game (same year as skyrim released) IT LOOKS LIKE IT COULD RUN ON WINDOWS 98.  Pretty sure the enemies would suit an N64 game. But I'm also pretty sure the zombie model has been used in other games, so this game most likey uses Unity Engine assets.   They even made a verson called CastleMiner that's just creative. They probably made the 2 versions to make more money from you buying them, though CastleMiner doesn't seem to be on steam...hmmm.  I give the game: 1 kick in the nuts followed by watching your entire family being tortured to death while on fire/10  P.S: the current price of under £1 seems too high for a piece of sh*t like this, it's worth about a penny.
Great Game

Well, first thing I want to say is I am a huge DigitalDNA fanboy. I love all of their games on the Xbox 360, and I hope that they respond to this review to give me some kind information. I'll begin my review by saying, resolution is a problem. DNA needs to add changing resolution and meaningful graphics settings to make the game playable for more PC gamers. I personally can not give much information about the gameplay, seeing as I can not play the game with it's current graphics, but from the laggy walkthrough I did, it seems pretty similar to the Xbox 360 version. When they update the graphics settings and add changing resolution, I will definitely bump up my review, but until then, I'm one dissapointed fanboy. :(

I got this game for free. That's a relief. I enjoy it, but it's buggy and unfinished. I don't see anything happening to improve the development. Avoid it. Another reviewer mentioned he would rather drag his private bits through 70 miles of ground glass or something like that. I thought he was going easy on the developers. The LAN play isn't even properly implemented. You host a server, everyone can join. If you switch it to friends only, nobody can join and you can't even invite them... at least that was my experience. As a Minecraft mod, it would have maybe been okay. As a standalone, it's worthless.

Don't believe any of the positive reviews, period. This game attempts to take multiple popular franchises and mash them together into some horrible abomination of a 'game'. The characters look like they're ripped from a Nintendo 64 shooter, the landscape is what you'd expect from a mobile phone Minecraft ripoff, and the enemies look far worse than the House of the Dead shooter that has been around since 1996. If someone got this game for you, they're trolling you. If you bought this game for yourself, no matter what sale it was on, you trolled yourself. I played this game as a test of irony with a friend and I can confidently say we saw all of the content within 2 hours of playtime.

Literally just a modded version of minecraft. Except the mod should be called ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game simulator. with ♥♥♥♥♥ier grahics and horrible gameplay.  The only gameplay this game has to offer is shooting zombies everywhere in a randomly generated map, and the resource gathering part of the game is complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t because of how easy it is just to get the best materials in the game and become insanely OP after just 5+ mins of digging. Then you can go on for a million waves and eventually come across these dragons that are just as OP as you are, but this time there is 500 of them and 1 of you. Literally 1 dragon could tear down a whole base made up of the best block in the game imaginable, making it impossible to `adapt` because of the huge ♥♥♥♥ing difficulty gap. The graphics are comeplete ♥♥♥♥. The zombies look like they came from grand theft auto 2 or 3, with thier choppy, geometric bodies. The animation is complete ♥♥♥♥ as well, the sounds are just irritating (THE ♥♥♥♥ING POP NOISE MKDSALHJKSDKWA). There is no story, and no main objective the only story there is is `Here is some ore and zombies, collect the ore make a gun and ♥♥♥♥ them up`. The castle you start out with has no other purpose than to hide on top of like a ♥♥♥♥♥, but even then skeletons snipe you with thier bows (Really, bows?! There is not much I can say about this game that is positive. To be honest I think most of it is taken from other games cut and paste into it. The gun sounds for example come from Half Life 1. The zombie sounds are the same as those used in 7days to die (not 100% sure which used them first since this game is older but it was ported to pc recently with some updates so it is possble). There are 2 diff types of models in this game that simply are as different as night and day. The skeletons and zombies look low res with sharp edges while the dragon and demons are so smooth and rounded they could have come from 2 different games. Its just a waste of your cash and this guy that made it already got his quick cash from the xbox indie marketplace and is now trying to do the same with the pc. Dont fall for this joke of a game and stay faaaar away.

The game is really worth it, but keep in mind that it has NOTHING related to minecraft, and the zombies Tend to outrun you, and the farther you go, the harder and faster zombies will be.

Castleminer Z is a game we all know, it just has a different skin.  I've played this game for 200 hours+ on Xbox 360, don't let my play time fool you. This is easily one of my top 10 games I have ever played. Why you ask? Well let me explain it to you.  Castleminer Z is a game where you collect resources, craft weapons, and fight hordes of zombies, spooky skeletons, dragons, aliens, and even Satan himself. Not only can you fight, but you can also build forts, and travel vast distances that will can make your friends wonder why you play this game so much. This game can challenge you, and make you feel proud that you got that far and killed that ice dragon. This is al well and good, but lets take a look at some real ups and downs.  The Pros-  Fun sandbox gameplay  Familiar FPS feel  Co-op  PVE/PVP  Building  Ranged/Melee combat  Good difficulty scale that can make you stop and rethink your plan/strategy  $5 is a good price point   The Cons-  Performance is mediocre  Not many graphical options, but some coming soon  Sensitivity  Game can feel boring without friends (opinion)  Boring, recycled textures from another game (Castleminer, only on Xbox 360)  Zombie hording can massively overwhelm and kill you almost instantly  Was a game that went with the trend of voxel graphics  PVP is there, but not very exciting   (may add more if i come up with stuff)  All and all, Castleminer Z is a pretty good game. I could recommend it to anyone who is a fan of Minecraft and likes survival zombie games. $5 is a good price point for this product, and a sale rolls around every now and then. If you can, get some friends to pick up the game or buy a four pack to play together. If you want to know more about this game, search it on youtube, there are plenty of videos on it from 2 years ago when this game was the ♥♥♥♥ on Xbox 360.

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through.' I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

I got this game gifted to me and just laughed and figured it would be horrible, just by looking at the picture. But then 4 hours of playing later, it's actually a really fun game. Yeah the graphics aren't the best, but the shear insanity of the game makes up for it. Going to each biome and fighting the biome-based dragons is one of the best things about it, they get harder the farther you travel, and you get decent loot from them too!   Another thing that makes this game great for the price that it is, is the fact that you're never really safe. Whether you're mining in a cave, or you're outside wandering the biomes. There's always going to be messed up looking aliens, zombies, and skeletons shooting their arrows at you from a far. Also the fact that in caves they just magically fall from above you and land on your head is terrifyingly great, you never expect it and it scares you every time, sending you into a panic and firing an obseen amount of bullets into their faces....mind you that is really satisfying.   Also the variety of weapons that you can get is awesome, nothing beats pulling out an AK and completly destroying mobs.   To sum it all up, in my opinion this game is 100% worth $2. I would still buy it even if it was more that $2. So buy yourself a copy and get ready to have some fun.

Is it a Minecraft clone? Yes. Is it fun? Yes. I like this game. Originally I purchased it on the Xbox live indie market. It's buggy, it's silly, it's also a cheap alternative if you can't bring yourself to shell out 25 bucks for Minecraft. End of the day it's a lot of fun to build forts and survive nightly zombie hordes. If you are looking for a game to take seriously I cannot say this is the game for you, but if you just want to run around and build stuff and kill zombies it's a good time.

Great Game, totally recomend this for the price. Great when you and your friends are bored or just want some indie game fun with survival instead of playing Minecraft and then getting mad at your friends a few hours later. The option of No friendly fire is great so anyone can join your game, help you and not troll you by killing you. Teamwork is also important as you take down more powerful zombies throughout the days and elemental dragons in differnt terrains (biomes).  If you have played this on the Xbox 360, this is a big improvement including the better designed user interface. Controller Support works excellent with this game incase you dont know how to use keyboard and mouse or new to PC gaming.  FORTUNE LAND is still there, so make sure you go to No Enemies mode and go to 3000m. DIAMONDS and BLOODSTONE!!!

CastleMiner Z I remember playing this game on the XBOX 360 from the Indie Game section. This game has alot of protential if the makers would add more content to the game. This game is a sandbox creation world like 'Minecraft' although there is a lack of blocks and items to create within the world, they have add weapons; Railguns, shotguns, pistols and much more. This brings new elements to a sandbox game as you will find these items come in handy for the vast array of AI Mobs. Creating building within this game is very difficult as AI Mobs spawn all the time during the day, and can be a handful when there's more than one. They also have the ability to jump a vast distance. The game is built up like 'Minecraft' without portals to other Dimensions, alternatively when you dig down to what would be bedrock you will discover hell made up of blood stone. The stone can be crafted to create blood pickaxes which are useful to mine all blocks within the game. once you have this pickaxe you will notice you have a step meter on your screen, running in the north direction you will find new biom's which hold valuable rocks from railgun creation.   Over all the game has potential to become a great sandbox game. Graphics within the world (Rating 5/10) Controls (Rating 8/10) variety (Rating 2/10)  CastleMiner Z (Game Rating 3/10) With additional added features this rating could rise. If your looking for an alternative to minecraft this is brilliant but don't expect the same array of blocks and items.

It's not that great graphics but overall i think this game is worth the money.  i strongly recommend you to buy the 4-pack of this game and send the copies to some friends.  Thanks for reading and have a good day!

-Minecraft with guns  -Meh, boring  -Played it for a while offline.  -Farming dragons, what else will i do?  -Hosts server online  -Meets really nice guy  -We play together for atleast 2 hours  -Having fun  -Game notices that im actually having fun  -Game suddenly gives me huge and obnoxiously long lag spikes  -After a while of bearing it, i cant take it anymore  -Had to quit castleminerz and abandon my friend to see whats going on  -Think i fixed it  -Game wont even start now  -Dind't get a chance to friend that guy  10/10 I cry every single time

It's fun, at first. But it's too easy. Within 45-60 minutes, I can get the best stuff in the game. It has a dying community and very little replay value to me. I'm sad that I spent money on it, and wish I hadn't. Although I do not recommend this game, that doesn't mean you shouldn't try it for yourself, as my opinion is exactly that. An opinion. If you like minecraft and want a bit less of a challenge, go ahead and buy this. Before I conclude this review, I do want to mention that the 2 biggest reasons I am not recommending this game is simply because of the playtime, and because it's community is basically dead. Everyone I've met who still plays either kicks me, griefs, or is just a huge jerk. (I'm avoiding a choice word.) I won't play it again, but if you've got spare change and want something to fill a bit of time, go ahead and give this a try.

CastleMiner Z is a game that blew my mind back when I used to play console, and the fact that I could get it for my PC when I switched is just great. It's an amazing game, so much to do, so much to craft, and so much to build. Probably one of my favorite Indie games out there, and as I only have 2 hours logged so far I will most DEFINITLEY be putting more time into this game!

i played this game on the xbox360 and i loved it a really good game so i bought this game on steam because they dont update the xbox360 anymore.

Ignore all these reveiws saying that its just a bad minecraft. Because this game is NOT minecraft. Me and my friend back in the xbox360 days would actually stop playing minecraft to play this. Whats minecraft got? Swords and slow moving zombies? In this game we built a fortress and loaded it up with Lmg's and AK's and RPG's and would prepare for a zombie hoard to attack us. plus the world size is way bigger than 360's minecraft. There are so many different weapons that I remember everywhere from a pistol to a lightsaber. plus enimies too. minecraft has a skelliton, zombie and a creeper basically. this game has zombies, skellitons, deamons, aliens and some i havent even discovered yet in my many hours playing on 360. So if you say this game is bad because its 'Just Like Minecraft' you're wrong
one of my favorite games but add more items and stuff i recommend this to all gamers

Pretty fun game, if a zombie gets next to you you instantly die after 1000 meters, cant shoot demons, dragons are now a one hit kill (for me to kill them) The aliens have more health than most of the dragons i've come across, the animation is funny, achievements dont work, and the zombies jump like ♥♥♥♥ing psychos making them hard to hit with the already funky controls.  7.5/10

I played this game when it was released for Xbox. It was a cool game. I see they have made updates to the game since then which is even cooler. I like the new fly mode. My only suggestion is that there be more building materials and designs available, wall selections are in need of more options. Also not sure if it is a bug or what but my game closed earlier and gave me an error message saying that the game ran out of memory. I have 16GB of memory and this computer is a fairly new Desktop.
It's much more fun and challenging than similar games.
yes this game is great! it reminds me of the old dayz on xbox 360 :)! definately buy it!
they say it was shity but they have an awsome active community. Looking forward to future updates.

Alright here we go. So as you can see I only have 13 hours in this game (On my way to get at least 50. Game is still fun as I remember it.)  I've been playing since it's early Xbox 360 days. And in my opinion, is it worth it? Short answer: Yes.  Here's to keep things short.  Pros: + Don't wanna have to go through the 1-5 minute hassle of getting a gun mod on Minecraft? Get this games + Game will rip you a new one on Endurance, DON'T GO OUT AT NIGHT UNLESS YOU HAVE SOMETHING OTHER THAN A PISTOL AND KNIFE. + Cool, dragons and no need to do all the tedious tasks of going to some other dimension. + Endurance is hella fun once something like a shotgun or assault rifle is accquired. + Creative has been heavily updated since it was first release. Fly mode my dudes. + Seperate goals to complete during Endurance mode (Killing The Undead Dragon is pretty much, top priority.) + Hell biome literally sticks to it's name. (ESPECIALLY in Endurance) + Dragon Endurance is unlocked once killing the undead dragon. + Easily able to hack your items. (lol) + You can literally make a lightsaber + Fun as hell with friends (if only a friend would purchase this game. Come on lads, it's only 4 bucks.) + Got sp00ked by the demon like monster. 10/10 would ♥♥♥♥ myself again. + PvP (Though I'm not a PvP guy)  Cons: - Will be hearing the main menu screen. A LOT. (This is due to ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s kicking anyone who they don't know) - Community is, eh. Also kind of small. (This is because obviously peeps wanna play some ol' fashion Minecraft instead.) - The minute PvP is turned on, all hell breaks lose. (You best hope to god you're not near someone with anything that ain't a pistol.) - Totalbiscut destroyed it with his 12 year old fanbase. (Joking obviously, fanbase died the second minecraft got on Xbox.) - Not much fun alone - Can and will crash possibly (You just have to pray) - Optimization is odd within this game.  Overall Rating  7/10[ /b]  Will probably do a vid review of this game and update this review if I do.
